title: Archive through November 16, 2001
content:
I'm writing a paper that includes a section on word shape recognition in reading. Does anyone know any good readability readings that deal with this? Thanks.   
   
cr
author: anonymous

comments.content:
OH yeah.   
But most of it is very vague. The only guy who's   
addressed it directly/scientifically that I know of   
is Dutch psychologist Herman Bouma. Although he   
hasn't written a book, he has written a number of   
articles/papers which should be available through   
a good university library, or at least through ILL.   
   
And if you don't mind referring to a   
disreputable source you could check out   
my piece in "Graphic Design & Reading":   
 [http://gunnarswanson.com/GDandR/GDandR\_Book.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417031053/http:/gunnarswanson.com/GDandR/GDandR_Book.html)
